alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 15 at 11:05PM CST until February 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations ranging anywhere from 2 to 6 inches. N to NNW winds at 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with heavy snow in addition to blowing and drifting snow. Road closures are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will gradually decrease in intensity overnight, ending from west to east around sunrise Thursday morning. Dangerous travel conditions will persist well after snow ends. Locally reduced visibilities associated with blowing snow can be expected during the day on Thursday.
info.instruction: Consider alternate travel plans. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
